Paragraph.Text: is classified under tariff item No. 9804.10.00, 9804.20.00, 9805.00.00 or 9807.00.00 in the List of Tariff Provisions set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: would be classified under tariff item No. 9804.10.00 or 9804.20.00 in that List but for the fact that the total value for duty as determined under section 46 of the Customs Act of all goods imported by the person at that time exceeds the maximum value specified in that tariff item.

Subsection.Text: A special duty is imposed on traveller’s tobacco at the time it is imported at the rates set out in section 2 of Schedule 3.

Subsection.MarginalNote: When and how duty is payable
Subsection.Text: The special duty shall be paid and collected under the Customs Act, and interest and penalties shall be imposed, calculated, paid and collected under that Act, as if the special duty were a duty levied under section 20 of the Customs Tariff, and for those purposes, the Customs Act applies with any modifications that the circumstances require.
The special duty is not imposed on traveller’s tobacco imported by an individual for their personal use if duty under section 42 was previously imposed on the tobacco and the tobacco is stamped.

Section.Text: In sections 56 to 58, tobacco product means manufactured tobacco other than partially manufactured tobacco.

Subsection.Text: A special duty is imposed on a tobacco product that is manufactured in Canada and exported

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the export is in accordance with paragraph 50(4)(a) by the tobacco licensee who manufactured it, at the rates set out in section 3 of Schedule 3; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, at the rates set out in section 4 of Schedule 3.

Subsection.MarginalNote: When and by whom duty is payable
Subsection.Text: Subject to sections 57 and 58, the special duty is payable, at the time the tobacco product is exported, by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if paragraph (1)(a) applies, the tobacco licensee who manufactured it; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if paragraph (1)(b) applies, the person who exported it.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty relieved — deliveries to a foreign duty free shop and as foreign ships’ stores
Section.Text: The special duty imposed under section 56 is relieved on a tobacco product that is exported by the tobacco licensee who manufactured it for delivery to a foreign duty free shop or as foreign ships’ stores.

Subsection.Text: The special duty imposed under section 56 is relieved on a tobacco product of a particular brand if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the tobacco product of that brand is prescribed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: during the three-year period before the year in which the tobacco product of that brand is exported, the tobacco product of that brand was not sold in Canada, other than in a duty free shop, except in quantities not significantly greater than the minimum quantities sufficient for the purposes of registering the trademark for that brand; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: during any year before the three-year period referred to in paragraph (b), sales in Canada of the product of that brand never exceeded

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: 0.5% of total sales in Canada of similar products, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if another percentage that is less than 0.5% is prescribed for the purposes of this subsection, that percentage of total sales in Canada of similar products.

Subsection.Text: The special duty imposed under section 56 is relieved on cigarettes of a particular type or formulation manufactured in Canada and exported under a brand that is also applied to cigarettes of a different type or formulation that are manufactured and sold in Canada if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cigarettes of the particular type or formulation exported under that brand are prescribed; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cigarettes of the particular type or formulation have never been sold in Canada under that brand or any other brand.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of subsection (2), a cigarette of a particular type or formulation sold under a brand may be considered to be different from another cigarette sold under that brand if it is reasonable to consider them to be different having regard to their physical characteristics before and during consumption.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: adjustment day means

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: February 28, 2018;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: April 20, 2021; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an inflationary adjusted year, April 1 of that year. (date d’ajustement)

Definition.Text: inflationary adjusted year has the same meaning as in subsection 43.1(1). (année inflationniste)
separate retail establishment of a person means a shop or store of the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is geographically separate from other places of business of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at which, in the ordinary course of the person’s business, the person regularly sells, otherwise than through vending machines, tobacco products to consumers, within the meaning of section 123 of the Excise Tax Act, attending at the shop or store; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of which separate records are maintained. (établissement de détail distinct)

Definition.Text: taxed cigarettes of a person means cigarettes in respect of which duty has been imposed under section 42 or 53 at the rate applicable on the day before an adjustment day, and that, at the beginning of the adjustment day,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: were owned by that person for sale in the ordinary course of a business of the person;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: were not held in a vending machine; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: were not relieved from that duty under this Act. (cigarettes imposées)

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 58.3, every person shall pay to Her Majesty a tax on all taxed cigarettes of the person held at the beginning of March 23, 2017 at the rate of $0.00265 per cigarette.
Subject to section 58.3, every person shall pay to Her Majesty a tax on all taxed cigarettes of the person held at the beginning of February 28, 2018 at the rate of $0.011468 per cigarette.
Subject to section 58.3, every person shall pay to Her Majesty a tax on all taxed cigarettes of the person held at the beginning of April 20, 2021 at the rate of $0.02 per cigarette.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Imposition of tax — inflationary adjusted years
Subsection.Text: Subject to section 58.3, every person shall pay to Her Majesty a tax on all taxed cigarettes of the person held at the beginning of April 1 of an inflationary adjusted year at a rate per cigarette equal to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cigarettes in respect of which duty has been imposed under section 42, the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the rate of duty applicable under section 1 of Schedule 1 for each five cigarettes on April 1 of the inflationary adjusted year, and
is the rate of duty applicable under section 1 of Schedule 1 for each five cigarettes on March 31 of the inflationary adjusted year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cigarettes in respect of which duty has been imposed under section 53, the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the rate of duty applicable under paragraph 1(a) of Schedule 3 per cigarette on April 1 of the inflationary adjusted year, and
is the rate of duty applicable under paragraph 1(a) of Schedule 3 per cigarette on March 31 of the inflationary adjusted year.

Subsection.Text: The amount determined under paragraph (2)(a) or (b) is to be rounded to the nearest one-hundred-thousandth or, if the amount is equidistant from two consecutive one-hundred-thousandths, to the higher one-hundred-thousandth.

Section.Text: Tax under this Part in respect of the inventory of all taxed cigarettes of a person that is held at the beginning of an adjustment day at a separate retail establishment of the person is not payable if that retail establishment holds inventory of 30,000 or fewer cigarettes.
Every person liable to pay tax under this Part shall, for the purposes of this Part, determine that person’s inventory of all taxed cigarettes held at the beginning of an adjustment day.

Subsection.Text: Every person liable to pay tax under this Part shall file a return with the Minister in the prescribed form and manner on or before,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(1), May 31, 2017;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(1.1), April 30, 2018;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(1.2), June 30, 2021; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(2) in respect of an inflationary adjusted year, May 31 of the inflationary adjusted year.

Subsection.Text: A person authorized under subsection 239(2) of the Excise Tax Act to file separate returns in respect of a separate branch or division may file separate returns under this Part in respect of that branch or division.
Every person shall pay to the Receiver General the total tax payable by the person under this Part on or before

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(1), May 31, 2017;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(1.1), April 30, 2018;

Paragraph.Label: (a.2)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(1.2), June 30, 2021; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the tax imposed under subsection 58.2(2) in respect of an inflationary adjusted year, May 31 of the inflationary adjusted year.

Subsection.Text: No interest in respect of an amount payable by a person under this Part is payable if, at the time the person pays the amount, the total of that interest otherwise payable is less than $25.
The Minister may at any time extend in writing the time for filing a return, or paying the tax payable, under this Part and, where the Minister so extends the time,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the return shall be filed or tax payable shall be paid within the time as so extended; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: interest is payable under section 170 as if the time had not been extended.

Section.MarginalNote: Application — Importation of Intoxicating Liquors Act
Section.Text: For greater certainty, the Importation of Intoxicating Liquors Act continues to apply to the importation, sending, taking and transportation of intoxicating liquor into a province.

If alcohol is imported under circumstances in which subsection 3(1) of the Importation of Intoxicating Liquors Act applies, the alcohol is deemed, for the purposes of this Act and subsection 21.2(3) of the Customs Tariff, to have been imported by the person who would have been the importer in the absence of that subsection 3(1) and not by Her Majesty in right of a province or a liquor authority.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — production and packaging of spirits

Subsection.Text: No person shall, except in accordance with a spirits licence issued to the person, produce or package spirits.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the packaging of spirits from a marked special container by a purchaser at a bottle-your-own premises; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the production of spirits for the purpose or as a consequence of the analysis of the composition of a substance containing absolute ethyl alcohol.

Section.Text: No person shall possess a still or other equipment suitable for the production of spirits with the intent of producing spirits unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a spirits licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a pending application for a spirits licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: possesses the still or equipment solely for the purpose of producing spirits for the purpose or as a consequence of the analysis of the composition of a substance containing absolute ethyl alcohol.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — production and packaging of wine

Subsection.Text: No person shall, except in accordance with a wine licence issued to the person, produce or package wine.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the production of wine by an individual for their personal use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the packaging of wine referred to in paragraph (a) by an individual for their personal use; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the packaging of wine from a marked special container by a purchaser at a bottle-your-own premises.

Section.Text: Except as permitted under section 130, no person shall use bulk spirits to fortify bulk wine.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — sale of wine produced for personal use
Section.Text: No person shall sell or put to a commercial use wine that was produced, or produced and packaged, by an individual for their personal use.
For the purposes of this Act, wine is not produced or packaged by an individual if it has been produced or packaged by a person acting on their behalf.

No person shall carry on at a ferment-on-premises facility any activity specified in a licence or registration issued under this Act other than an activity specified in a ferment-on-premises registration.

Sections 67 to 72, 75, 76, 80, 85, 88, 97 to 100 and 102 do not apply to imported alcohol or specially denatured alcohol that is, in accordance with the Customs Act, the Customs Tariff and the regulations made under those Acts,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: transported by a customs bonded carrier from a place outside Canada to another place outside Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: stored in a customs bonded warehouse or sufferance warehouse for subsequent delivery to a place outside Canada; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: transported by a customs bonded carrier

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: from a place outside Canada to a customs bonded warehouse or a sufferance warehouse for subsequent delivery to a place outside Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: from a customs bonded warehouse or a sufferance warehouse to a place outside Canada.

Section.Text: No person shall sell

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: bulk alcohol unless it was produced or imported in accordance with this Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: packaged alcohol unless it was, in accordance with this Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: produced and packaged in Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: imported and packaged in Canada, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: imported; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a marked special container of alcohol unless it was marked in accordance with this Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Availability and sampling of imported DA and SDA

Subsection.Text: Any person who imports a product that is reported under the Customs Act as being denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol shall make the product available for sampling and the product is required to be sampled by the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness before it is released under that Act.
The samples must be tested to verify that the product is denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol.
The Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness may at any time waive the requirement to sample an imported product under subsection (1).

The Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness may fix fees to be paid by the importer of the product but those fees must not exceed an amount determined by that Minister to be the costs to Her Majesty in respect of the sampling and testing.

Section.Text: No person shall own bulk alcohol unless it was produced or imported in accordance with this Act.

Subsection.Text: No person shall possess bulk alcohol.
Subsection (1) does not apply

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a spirits licensee or a licensed user who possesses bulk spirits that were produced or imported by a spirits licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to a wine licensee or a licensed user who possesses bulk wine that was produced or imported by a wine licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to a licensed user who possesses bulk alcohol that was imported by the licensed user;

Paragraph.Label: (c.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of bulk spirits produced for the purpose or as a consequence of the analysis of the composition of a substance containing absolute ethyl alcohol, to a person who, having produced those spirits, possesses them during the period of analysis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: to an alcohol registrant who possesses, for the purposes of storage or transportation, bulk alcohol that was produced by an alcohol licensee or imported by an alcohol licensee or licensed user;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: to a sufferance warehouse licensee who possesses in their sufferance warehouse bulk alcohol that was imported by a person permitted to do so under this Act;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: to a ferment-on-premises registrant who possesses bulk wine that was produced at the registrant’s ferment-on-premises facility by an individual for the individual’s personal use; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: to an individual who possesses less than 500 L of bulk wine that was lawfully produced at a residence or a ferment-on-premises facility for an individual’s personal use.

Section.Text: No person shall give possession of bulk spirits to a person other than a spirits licensee, a licensed user or an alcohol registrant.

Subsection.Text: No person shall give possession of bulk wine to a person other than a wine licensee, a licensed user or an alcohol registrant.
Subsection (1) does not apply to an individual who, in connection with their personal use of it, gives possession of bulk wine lawfully produced by an individual for their personal use.

Section.Text: A licensed user shall not use or dispose of bulk alcohol other than to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: use it in an approved formulation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use it in a process in which the absolute ethyl alcohol is destroyed to the extent approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: use it to produce vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: use it in accordance with section 130, 131 or 131.1;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: return it to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of alcohol returned in circumstances to which paragraph 105(1)(a) or 114(1)(a) applies, a licensee referred to in that paragraph, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any other case, the alcohol licensee who supplied it;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: subject to section 76, export it;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: use it for analysis in a manner approved by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: destroy it in a manner approved by the Minister.

Section.Text: A person who possesses bulk spirits produced for the purpose or as a consequence of the analysis of the composition of a substance containing absolute ethyl alcohol shall, immediately after the analysis is complete, destroy or dispose of the spirits in a manner approved by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: No person shall import bulk spirits other than a spirits licensee, a licensed user or, if the spirits are in a special container, an excise warehouse licensee in accordance with section 80.
No person shall import bulk wine other than a wine licensee, a licensed user or, if the wine is in a special container, an excise warehouse licensee in accordance with section 85.

Section.Text: No person shall export bulk alcohol other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the alcohol licensee who is responsible for the alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed user who imported the alcohol; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a person required to do so under section 101.

Section.Text: If a special container of spirits is marked, the spirits are deemed to be packaged at the time the container is marked.

Subsection.Text: No person shall mark a special container of spirits unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a spirits licensee; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the container is one that has been placed in a sufferance warehouse in accordance with section 80 and the person marks the container in the circumstances described in that section.

Subsection.Text: If a spirits licensee marks a special container of spirits, the licensee shall immediately enter it into an excise warehouse.

Section.Text: No person, other than an excise warehouse licensee, shall import a marked special container of spirits.

If a special container of spirits that is imported by an excise warehouse licensee is not marked when it is reported under the Customs Act, it shall be placed in a sufferance warehouse for the purpose of being marked.
If a marked special container of spirits is released under the Customs Act, the excise warehouse licensee who imported it shall immediately enter it into their excise warehouse.
If a special container of wine is marked, the wine is deemed to be packaged at the time the container is marked.

Subsection.Text: No person shall mark a special container of wine unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a wine licensee; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the container is one that has been placed in a sufferance warehouse in accordance with section 85 and the person marks the container in the circumstances described in that section.

Subsection.Text: If a wine licensee marks a special container of wine, the licensee shall immediately enter it into an excise warehouse.

Section.Text: No person, other than an excise warehouse licensee, shall import a marked special container of wine.

If a special container of wine that is imported by an excise warehouse licensee is not marked when it is reported under the Customs Act, it shall be placed in a sufferance warehouse for the purpose of being marked.
If a marked special container of wine is released under the Customs Act, the excise warehouse licensee who imported it shall immediately enter it into their excise warehouse.
Every alcohol licensee who packages alcohol shall cause all prescribed information to be displayed on the container containing the alcohol and on any packaging encasing the container

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of wine that is entered into an excise warehouse immediately after it is packaged, before the wine is removed from the warehouse;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of wine on which duty is not imposed because of paragraph 135(2)(a), before the wine is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: removed from the licensee’s premises,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: consumed, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: made available for sale on the premises; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case, immediately after the alcohol is packaged.

Subsection.Text: No person shall possess non-duty-paid packaged alcohol.
Non-duty-paid packaged alcohol, other than alcohol in a marked special container,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is packaged by an alcohol licensee or imported by an excise warehouse licensee may be possessed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an excise warehouse licensee in their excise warehouse,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed user in their specified premises,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a registered user for use in accordance with their registration,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed person who is transporting the alcohol under prescribed circumstances and conditions,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a duty free shop licensee, in their duty free shop,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an accredited representative, for their personal or official use, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a person as ships’ stores, if the acquisition and possession of the alcohol by that person are in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that is imported may be possessed by a sufferance warehouse licensee, in their sufferance warehouse;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that is imported by a licensed user may be possessed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the licensed user in their specified premises, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed person who is transporting the alcohol under prescribed circumstances and conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that is imported by an accredited representative may be possessed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the accredited representative, for their personal or official use, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed person who is transporting the alcohol under prescribed circumstances and conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: that is imported for sale in a duty free shop, for sale to an accredited representative or for use as ships’ stores, may be possessed by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a customs bonded warehouse licensee, in their customs bonded warehouse,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a duty free shop licensee, in their duty free shop,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an accredited representative, for their personal or official use,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a customs bonded carrier in accordance with the Customs Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a person as ships’ stores, if the acquisition and possession of the alcohol by that person are in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: that is imported for supply to an air carrier that is licensed under section 69 or 73 of the Canada Transportation Act to operate an international air service may be possessed by a customs bonded warehouse licensee, in their customs bonded warehouse;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: that is imported by an individual in accordance with the Customs Act and the Customs Tariff for their personal use may be possessed by an individual;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: that is wine that is produced and packaged by an individual for their personal use may be possessed by an individual;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: that is wine referred to in paragraph 135(2)(a) or (b) may be possessed by any person; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: that is wine produced or packaged by a wine licensee and removed from the excise warehouse of the licensee and that is to be provided free of charge to individuals as a sample consumed at the premises where the licensee produces or packages wine may be possessed by the licensee or those individuals at those premises.

Subsection.Text: A non-duty-paid marked special container of alcohol may be possessed by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an excise warehouse licensee in their excise warehouse;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed person who is transporting the alcohol under prescribed circumstances and conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an imported special container of alcohol, a sufferance warehouse licensee in their sufferance warehouse; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a special container of spirits that is marked for delivery to and use by a registered user, a registered user for use in accordance with their registration.

Section.Text: A ferment-on-premises registrant shall not store packaged wine at their ferment-on-premises facility.
A licensed user shall not use or dispose of non-duty-paid packaged alcohol other than to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: use it in an approved formulation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use it in a process in which the absolute ethyl alcohol is destroyed to the extent approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: use it to produce vinegar;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: return it under prescribed conditions to the excise warehouse licensee who supplied it;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: export it, if the alcohol was imported by the licensed user;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: use it for analysis in a manner approved by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: destroy it in a manner approved by the Minister.

Section.Text: A registered user shall not use or dispose of non-duty-paid packaged spirits other than to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: use them in accordance with their registration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: use them for analysis in a manner approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: return them under prescribed conditions to the excise warehouse licensee who supplied them; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: destroy them in a manner approved by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: No person shall remove spirits from a marked special container of spirits other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a registered user, in the case of a container that is marked for delivery to and use by a registered user; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a purchaser of the spirits at a bottle-your-own premises, in the case of a container that is marked for delivery to and use at a bottle-your-own premises.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Removal of spirits from returned container
Subsection.Text: If the operator of a bottle-your-own premises returns a marked special container of spirits to the excise warehouse licensee who supplied the container to the operator, the licensee may remove the spirits from the container for the purpose of destroying the spirits in a manner approved by the Minister.
No person shall remove wine from a marked special container of wine other than a purchaser of the wine at a bottle-your-own premises.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Removal of wine from returned container
Subsection.Text: If the operator of a bottle-your-own premises returns a marked special container of wine to the excise warehouse licensee who supplied the container to the operator, the licensee may remove the wine from the container for the purpose of destroying the wine in a manner approved by the Minister.

Section.Text: A licensed user shall not use or dispose of a restricted formulation other than in accordance with the conditions or restrictions imposed by the Minister under section 143.
No person other than a licensed user or an alcohol registrant shall possess a restricted formulation.

Heading.TitleText: Denatured Alcohol and Specially Denatured Alcohol

Section.Text: No person, other than a spirits licensee, shall denature spirits.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell or provide denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol for use in or as a beverage.
No person shall use denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol in or as a beverage.

Section.Text: No person shall, except in accordance with a specially denatured alcohol registration issued to the person, use specially denatured alcohol.

Subsection.Text: No person shall possess specially denatured alcohol.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a spirits licensee or an SDA registrant who possesses specially denatured alcohol produced by a spirits licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a spirits licensee, an SDA registrant or a sufferance warehouse licensee who possesses specially denatured alcohol imported by a spirits licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an SDA registrant who possesses specially denatured alcohol that they imported;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a sufferance warehouse licensee who possesses specially denatured alcohol imported by an SDA registrant; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an alcohol registrant who possesses specially denatured alcohol only for the purposes of its storage and transportation, if the alcohol was produced by a spirits licensee or imported by a spirits licensee or an SDA registrant.

Section.Text: No person shall give possession of specially denatured alcohol to a person who is not a spirits licensee, an SDA registrant or an alcohol registrant.

Subsection.Text: No person shall sell specially denatured alcohol.
Subsection (1) does not apply where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a spirits licensee sells specially denatured alcohol to another spirits licensee or to an SDA registrant; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an SDA registrant returns specially denatured alcohol in accordance with paragraph 103(a) or exports it in accordance with paragraph 103(b).

Section.Text: No person shall import specially denatured alcohol other than a spirits licensee or an SDA registrant.

Section.MarginalNote: Spirits mistakenly imported as DA or SDA

Subsection.Text: If a person, other than a spirits licensee or licensed user, who has imported a product that was reported under the Customs Act as being denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol learns that the product is spirits and not denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol, the person shall without delay

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: export it for return to the person from whom it was acquired; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dispose of or destroy it in the manner specified by the Minister.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Spirits mistakenly possessed as DA or SDA
Subsection.Text: If a person, other than a spirits licensee, licensed user or alcohol registrant, who possesses a product that the person believed was denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol learns that the product is spirits and not denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol, the person shall without delay

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: return it to the spirits licensee who produced or supplied the product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dispose of or destroy it in the manner specified by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: If the person is unable to comply with subsection (1) or (2) in respect of an amount of the product because they had already used it in the production of another product before they learned that the product was not denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol, the person shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dispose of or destroy the other product in the manner specified by the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pay any penalty imposed under section 254 for which they are liable under section 244 in respect of the amount.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (3) does not apply if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the other product is not, in the opinion of the Minister, spirits;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister deems the other product to have been produced using denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol, as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person complies with any conditions imposed by the Minister.

Section.Text: No person shall export specially denatured alcohol other than the SDA registrant who imported it or a spirits licensee.
An SDA registrant shall not dispose of specially denatured alcohol other than to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: return it to the spirits licensee who supplied it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: export it, if it was imported by the SDA registrant; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: destroy it in a manner approved by the Minister.

Section.Text: Subject to sections 105 to 107, 111 and 112, the person who is responsible for bulk spirits at any time is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the spirits licensee or licensed user who owns the spirits at that time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the spirits are not owned at that time by a spirits licensee or licensed user, the spirits licensee or licensed user who last owned them; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the spirits were never owned by a spirits licensee or licensed user, the spirits licensee who imported or produced them or the licensed user who imported them.

Section.MarginalNote: Return of spirits purchased from unlicensed person

Subsection.Text: This section applies if a spirits licensee or licensed user (in this section referred to as the “purchaser”) purchases bulk spirits from a person who is not a spirits licensee or licensed user (in this section referred to as the “unlicensed person”), and, within 30 days after the purchaser receives the spirits,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the purchaser returns the spirits to the spirits licensee who was responsible for them immediately before they were purchased by the purchaser (in this section referred to as the “previously responsible licensee”) or to the spirits licensee who supplied them (in this section referred to as the “supplier”); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ownership of the spirits reverts to the unlicensed person.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Determination of person responsible for returned spirits
Subsection.Text: At the later of the time at which the previously responsible licensee or supplier receives the spirits and the time at which the ownership of the spirits reverts to the unlicensed person,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the previously responsible licensee becomes again responsible for the spirits; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purchaser of the spirits ceases to be responsible for them.

Section.Text: If, at any time, the government of a province or a liquor authority that is a spirits licensee or a licensed user owns bulk spirits for a purpose not related to its licence, section 104 applies as though that ownership by the government or the liquor authority did not exist at that time.
A licensed user who imports bulk spirits is responsible for them.

Section.MarginalNote: Blended spirits — joint and several or solidary responsibility

Subsection.Text: If bulk spirits are blended with other bulk spirits, or if bulk spirits are blended with bulk wine and the resulting product is spirits, every person who is a person responsible for any of the spirits or who is a licensed user responsible for any of the bulk wine is jointly and severally or solidarily responsible for the resulting blended spirits.

The wine licensee or licensed user who was responsible for the bulk wine before it was blended with bulk spirits as described in subsection (1) ceases to be responsible for the wine as of the time of blending.

Section.Text: A person who is responsible for bulk spirits ceases to be responsible for them if they are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: taken for use and the duty on them is paid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: taken for use in an approved formulation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: taken for use for a purpose described in section 145 or subsection 146(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: denatured into denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: exported in accordance with this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: lost in prescribed circumstances, if the person fulfills any prescribed conditions.

Section.Text: If a spirits licensee or licensed user (in this section referred to as the “purchaser”) purchases bulk spirits from a person who is not a spirits licensee or licensed user, the purchaser shall, except in respect of bulk spirits that are to be imported,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time of the purchase, obtain from the vendor the name and address of the spirits licensee who is responsible for the spirits immediately before they are sold to the purchaser; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: without delay, notify in writing that licensee of the purchase.

Section.Text: If an unmarked special container of spirits is removed by a spirits licensee from their excise warehouse in accordance with section 156, the licensee is responsible for the spirits unless they are owned by another spirits licensee or a licensed user, in which case the other spirits licensee or the licensed user is responsible for them.

If spirits are removed by a spirits licensee from their excise warehouse in accordance with section 158, the licensee is responsible for the spirits unless they are owned by another spirits licensee or a licensed user, in which case the other spirits licensee or the licensed user is responsible for them.
Subject to sections 114 to 116, 120 and 121, the person who is responsible for bulk wine at any time is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the wine licensee or licensed user who owns the wine at that time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the wine is not owned at that time by a wine licensee or licensed user, the wine licensee or licensed user who last owned it; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the wine was never owned by a wine licensee or licensed user, the wine licensee who imported or produced it or the licensed user who imported it.

Section.MarginalNote: Return of wine purchased from unlicensed person

Subsection.Text: This section applies if a wine licensee or licensed user (in this section referred to as the “purchaser”) purchases bulk wine from a person who is not a wine licensee or licensed user (in this section referred to as the “unlicensed person”), and, within 30 days after the purchaser receives the wine,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the purchaser returns the wine to the wine licensee who was responsible for it immediately before it was purchased by the purchaser (in this section referred to as the “previously responsible licensee”) or to the wine licensee who supplied it (in this section referred to as the “supplier”); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ownership of the wine reverts to the unlicensed person.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Determination of person responsible for returned wine
Subsection.Text: At the later of the time at which the previously responsible licensee or supplier receives the wine and the time at which the ownership of the wine reverts to the unlicensed person,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the previously responsible licensee becomes again responsible for the wine; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the purchaser of the wine ceases to be responsible for it.

Section.Text: If, at any time, the government of a province or a liquor authority that is a wine licensee or a licensed user owns bulk wine for a purpose not related to its licence, section 113 applies as though that ownership by the government or the liquor authority did not exist at that time.
A licensed user who imports bulk wine is responsible for it.

Section.MarginalNote: Blended wine — joint and several or solidary responsibility

Subsection.Text: If bulk wine is blended with other bulk wine, or if bulk wine is blended with bulk spirits and the resulting product is wine, every person who is a person responsible for any of the wine or who is a licensed user responsible for any of the bulk spirits is jointly and severally or solidarily responsible for the resulting blended wine.

The spirits licensee or licensed user who was responsible for the bulk spirits before they were blended with bulk wine as described in subsection (1) ceases to be responsible for the spirits as of the time of blending.

Section.Text: If bulk spirits are produced from bulk wine, the wine licensee or licensed user who was responsible for the wine before it was used to produce the spirits ceases to be responsible for the wine at the time the spirits are produced.
A person who is responsible for bulk wine ceases to be responsible for it if it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: taken for use and the duty on it is paid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: taken for use in an approved formulation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: taken for use for a purpose described in section 145 or subsection 146(1);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: exported in accordance with this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: lost, if the loss is recorded in a manner authorized by the Minister.

Section.Text: If a wine licensee or licensed user (in this section referred to as the “purchaser”) purchases bulk wine from a person who is not a wine licensee or licensed user, the purchaser shall, except in respect of bulk wine that is to be imported,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time of the purchase, obtain from the vendor the name and address of the wine licensee who is responsible for the wine immediately before it is sold to the purchaser; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: without delay, notify in writing that licensee of the purchase.

Section.Text: If an unmarked special container of wine is removed by a wine licensee from their excise warehouse in accordance with section 156, the licensee is responsible for the wine unless the wine is owned by another wine licensee or a licensed user, in which case the other wine licensee or the licensed user is responsible for it.

If wine is removed by a wine licensee from their excise warehouse in accordance with section 157, the licensee is responsible for the wine unless it is owned by another wine licensee or a licensed user, in which case the other wine licensee or the licensed user is responsible for it.

Heading.TitleText: Imposition and Payment of Duty on Alcohol

Subsection.Text: Duty is imposed on spirits produced in Canada at the rate set out in section 1 of Schedule 4.
The duty is imposed at the time the spirits are produced.

Section.Text: If spirits do not contain more than 7% of absolute ethyl alcohol by volume at the time that they are packaged,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the duty imposed on the spirits under section 122 or levied under section 21.1 of the Customs Tariff is relieved; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: duty is imposed on the spirits at the rate set out in section 2 of Schedule 4.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: inflationary adjusted year means 2018 and every year after that year. (année inflationniste)
reference year means a 12-month period that begins on April 1 of a year and ends on March 31 of the following year. (année de référence)

Subsection.Text: Each rate of duty set out in Schedule 4 applicable in respect of a litre of absolute ethyl alcohol or in respect of a litre of spirits is to be adjusted on April 1 of an inflationary adjusted year so that the rate is equal to the greater of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the rate determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the rate of duty applicable to the litre of absolute ethyl alcohol or the litre of spirits, as the case may be, on March 31 of the inflationary adjusted year, and
is the amount, rounded to the nearest one-thousandth, or, if the amount is equidistant from two consecutive one-thousandths, rounded to the higher one-thousandth, determined by the formula
is the Consumer Price Index for the 12-month period ending on September 30 of the particular year preceding the inflationary adjusted year, and
is the Consumer Price Index for the 12-month period ending on September 30 of the year preceding the particular year, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the rate of duty referred to in the description of A in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The adjusted rate determined under subsection (2) is to be rounded to the nearest one-thousandth or, if the adjusted rate is equidistant from two consecutive one-thousandths, to the higher one-thousandth.
In this section, the Consumer Price Index for any 12-month period is the result arrived at by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: aggregating the Consumer Price Index for Canada, as published by Statistics Canada under the authority of the Statistics Act, for each month in that period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dividing the aggregate obtained under paragraph (a) by 12; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: rounding the result obtained under paragraph (b) to the nearest one-thousandth or, if the result obtained is equidistant from two consecutive one-thousandths, to the higher one-thousandth.

Subsection.Text: If duties on spirits are imposed in a reference year but become payable in another reference year that begins in an inflationary adjusted year, those duties are determined at the rate of duty as adjusted under subsection (2) on the first day of the other reference year.
Subject to sections 126 and 127, the duty imposed on spirits is payable at the time the spirits are packaged unless, immediately after packaging, they are entered into an excise warehouse.
Duty is payable by the person who is responsible for the spirits immediately before they are packaged.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Spirits licensee ceases to be liable for duty
Subsection.Text: If an excise warehouse licensee becomes liable under section 140 for duty on the spirits, the person required under subsection (2) to pay the duty ceases to be liable to pay it.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable when removed from warehouse
Section.Text: If packaged spirits are removed from an excise warehouse for entry into the duty-paid market, duty is payable on the spirits at the time of their removal and is payable by the excise warehouse licensee of the warehouse.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on bulk spirits taken for use
Section.Text: Subject to sections 144 to 146, if bulk spirits are taken for use, duty is payable at the time the spirits are taken for use by the person who is responsible for the spirits at that time.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on unaccounted bulk spirits

Subsection.Text: Duty is payable by the person who is responsible for bulk spirits on any portion of the spirits that cannot be accounted for by the person as being in the possession of a spirits licensee, a licensed user or an alcohol registrant.
The duty is payable at the time the spirits cannot be accounted for.
Subsection (1) does not apply in circumstances where the person is convicted of an offence under section 218 or is liable to pay a penalty under section 241.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on packaged spirits taken for use
Section.Text: Subject to sections 144 to 146, if non-duty-paid packaged spirits that are in the possession of an excise warehouse licensee or a licensed user are taken for use, duty is payable at the time the spirits are taken for use and is payable by the licensee or user.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on unaccounted packaged spirits

Subsection.Text: Duty is payable on non-duty-paid packaged spirits that have been received by an excise warehouse licensee or a licensed user but cannot be accounted for by the licensee or user

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as being in the excise warehouse of the licensee or the specified premises of the user;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as having been removed, used or destroyed in accordance with this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: as having been lost in prescribed circumstances, if the licensee or user fulfills any prescribed conditions.

Subsection.Text: Duty is payable by the licensee or user at the time the spirits cannot be accounted for.
A licensed user who is also a wine licensee may use bulk spirits to fortify wine to an alcoholic strength not in excess of 22.9% absolute ethyl alcohol by volume.
The duty imposed under section 122 or levied under section 21.1 of the Customs Tariff on the spirits that were used to fortify the wine is relieved.

Section.Text: A licensed user who is also a spirits licensee may blend bulk wine with spirits if the resulting product is spirits.
A licensed user who is also a spirits licensee may use bulk wine to produce spirits.

Section.MarginalNote: Deemed production of spirits — blending wine

Subsection.Text: If wine is blended with bulk spirits and the resulting product is spirits,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the duty imposed under section 122 or levied under section 21.1 of the Customs Tariff on the spirits that were blended with the wine is relieved; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the resulting spirits are deemed to be produced at the time of the blending.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deemed production of spirits — other blending
Subsection.Text: If a material or substance, other than spirits or wine, containing absolute ethyl alcohol is blended with bulk spirits or wine and the resulting product is spirits,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the duty imposed under section 122 or levied under section 21.1 of the Customs Tariff on the spirits that were blended with the material or substance is relieved; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the resulting spirits are deemed to be produced at the time of the blending.

Section.Text: If a spirits licensee denatures bulk spirits into denatured alcohol or specially denatured alcohol, the duty imposed on the spirits under section 122 or levied under section 21.1 of the Customs Tariff is relieved.

Subsection.Text: In addition to the duty levied under section 21.1 or 21.2 of the Customs Tariff, a special duty is imposed on imported spirits delivered to or imported by a licensed user at the rate set out in Schedule 5.
If a spirits licensee imports bulk spirits that are delivered to a licensed user, the special duty is payable at the time the spirits are delivered to the licensed user and is payable

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by the spirits licensee who is responsible for the spirits at that time;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed user is responsible for the spirits at that time and there was a spirits licensee who was responsible immediately before that time, by that spirits licensee; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the licensed user is responsible for the spirits at that time and there was not a spirits licensee who was responsible immediately before that time, by the spirits licensee who delivered the spirits.

Subsection.Text: If imported packaged spirits or imported spirits that have been packaged in Canada are removed from an excise warehouse for delivery to a licensed user, the special duty is payable by the excise warehouse licensee at the time the spirits are removed from the excise warehouse.
If bulk or packaged spirits are imported by a licensed user, the special duty

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is payable by the licensed user at the time the spirits are imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall be paid and collected under the Customs Act, and interest and penalties shall be imposed, calculated, paid and collected under that Act, as if the duty were a duty levied on the spirits under section 20 of the Customs Tariff, and, for those purposes, the Customs Act applies with any modifications that the circumstances require.

Section.MarginalNote: Imposition — bulk wine taken for use

Subsection.Text: Duty is imposed on bulk wine that is taken for use at the rates set out in Schedule 6.
Subject to sections 144 to 146, the duty is payable at the time the wine is taken for use and is payable by the person who is responsible for the wine at that time.
Subsection (1) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: wine that is produced in Canada and composed wholly of agricultural or plant product grown in Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: wine that is produced by an individual for their personal use and that is consumed in the course of that use.

Subsection.Text: Duty is imposed on wine that is packaged in Canada at the rates set out in Schedule 6.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Wine produced for personal use and by small producers
Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to wine that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: produced in Canada and composed wholly of agricultural or plant product grown in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: produced and packaged by an individual for their personal use; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: produced by a wine licensee and packaged by or on behalf of the licensee during a fiscal month in a particular fiscal year of the licensee if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the total sales by the licensee of products that are subject to duty under subsection (1), or that would have been so subject to duty in the absence of this subsection, in the fiscal year ending immediately before the particular fiscal year did not exceed $50,000, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the total sales by the licensee of those products during the particular fiscal year before the fiscal month did not exceed $50,000.

Subsection.Text: The duty is imposed at the time the wine is packaged. It is also payable at that time unless the wine is entered into an excise warehouse immediately after packaging.
The duty is payable by the person who is responsible for the wine immediately before it is packaged.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Wine licensee ceases to be liable for duty
Subsection.Text: If an excise warehouse licensee becomes liable under section 140 for duty on the wine, the person required under subsection (4) to pay the duty ceases to be liable to pay it.
The following definitions apply in this section.

Definition.Text: inflationary adjusted year means 2018 and every year after that year. (année inflationniste)
reference year means a 12-month period that begins on April 1 of a year and ends on March 31 of the following year. (année de référence)

Subsection.Text: Each rate of duty set out in Schedule 6 applicable in respect of a litre of wine is to be adjusted on April 1 of an inflationary adjusted year so that the rate is equal to the greater of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the rate determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the rate of duty applicable to the litre on March 31 of the inflationary adjusted year, and
is the amount, rounded to the nearest one-thousandth, or, if the amount is equidistant from two consecutive one-thousandths, rounded to the higher one-thousandth, determined by the formula
is the Consumer Price Index for the 12-month period ending on September 30 of the particular year preceding the inflationary adjusted year, and
is the Consumer Price Index for the 12-month period ending on September 30 of the year preceding the particular year, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the rate of duty referred to in the description of A in paragraph (a).

Subsection.Text: The adjusted rate determined under subsection (2) is to be rounded to the nearest one-thousandth or, if the adjusted rate is equidistant from two consecutive one-thousandths, to the higher one-thousandth.
In this section, the Consumer Price Index for any 12-month period is the result arrived at by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: aggregating the Consumer Price Index for Canada, as published by Statistics Canada under the authority of the Statistics Act, for each month in that period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dividing the aggregate obtained under paragraph (a) by 12; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: rounding the result obtained under paragraph (b) to the nearest one-thousandth or, if the result obtained is equidistant from two consecutive one-thousandths, to the higher one-thousandth.

Subsection.Text: If duties on wine are imposed in a reference year but become payable in another reference year that begins in an inflationary adjusted year, those duties are determined at the rate of duty as adjusted under subsection (2) on the first day of the other reference year.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on removal from warehouse

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), if packaged wine is removed from an excise warehouse for entry into the duty-paid market, duty is payable on the wine at the time of its removal and is payable by the excise warehouse licensee.

If a small wine licensee removes packaged wine that the licensee produced or packaged from the excise warehouse of the licensee for delivery and sale on a consignment basis at a retail store operated on behalf of two or more small wine licensees and that is not located on the premises of a wine licensee, the wine is deemed to be removed from the warehouse for entry into the duty-paid market at the time the wine is sold.

In this section, a wine licensee is a small wine licensee during a fiscal year of the licensee if, in the previous fiscal year, the total amount of wine sold by the licensee did not exceed 60,000 litres.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on packaged wine taken for use
Section.Text: Subject to sections 144 to 146, if non-duty-paid packaged wine that is in the possession of an excise warehouse licensee or a licensed user is taken for use, duty is payable on the wine at the time it is taken for use and is payable by the licensee or user.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty payable on unaccounted packaged wine

Subsection.Text: Duty is payable on non-duty-paid packaged wine that has been received by an excise warehouse licensee or a licensed user but that cannot be accounted for by the licensee or user

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as being in the excise warehouse of the licensee or the specified premises of the user;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of packaged wine described by subsection 136(2), as being in a store described by that subsection;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as having been removed, used or destroyed in accordance with this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: as having been lost in prescribed circumstances, if the licensee or user fulfills any prescribed conditions.

Subsection.Text: Duty is payable by the licensee or user at the time the wine cannot be accounted for.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty on wine in marked special container relieved

Subsection.Text: Duty imposed under subsection 135(1) is relieved on wine that is contained in a marked special container of wine from which the marking has been removed in accordance with section 156.

Duty imposed under subsection 135(1) or levied under subsection 21.2(2) of the Customs Tariff is relieved on wine that is returned to the bulk wine inventory of a wine licensee in accordance with section 157.

Heading.TitleText: Liability of Excise Warehouse Licensees and Licensed Users

Section.Text: If non-duty-paid packaged alcohol is entered into an excise warehouse immediately after being packaged, the excise warehouse licensee is liable for the duty on the alcohol at the time it is entered into the warehouse.

If, in accordance with subsection 21.2(3) of the Customs Tariff, imported packaged alcohol is, without the payment of duty, released under the Customs Act to the excise warehouse licensee or licensed user who imported it, the excise warehouse licensee or licensed user is liable for the duty on the alcohol.

Subsection.Text: If non-duty-paid packaged alcohol is removed from the excise warehouse of an excise warehouse licensee (in this subsection referred to as the “transferor”) to the excise warehouse of another excise warehouse licensee, at the time the alcohol is entered into the warehouse of the other licensee,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the other licensee becomes liable for the duty on the alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the transferor ceases to be liable for the duty.

Subsection.Text: If non-duty-paid packaged alcohol is removed from an excise warehouse to the specified premises of a licensed user, at the time the alcohol is entered into those premises,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed user becomes liable for the duty on the alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the excise warehouse licensee ceases to be liable for the duty.

Subsection.Text: If non-duty-paid packaged alcohol is removed from the specified premises of a licensed user to an excise warehouse, at the time the alcohol is entered into the warehouse,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the excise warehouse licensee becomes liable for the duty on the alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensed user ceases to be liable for the duty.

Heading.TitleText: Non-dutiable Uses and Removals of Alcohol

Section.Text: The Minister may impose any conditions or restrictions that the Minister considers necessary in respect of the making, importation, packaging, use or sale of, or other dealing with, an approved formulation.
Duty is relieved on bulk alcohol and non-duty-paid packaged alcohol used by a licensed user in an approved formulation.

Subsection.Text: Duty is not payable on bulk alcohol

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: taken for analysis by an alcohol licensee or a licensed user in a manner approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: destroyed by an alcohol licensee or a licensed user in a manner approved by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: used by a licensed user in a process in which the absolute ethyl alcohol is destroyed to the extent approved by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Duty is not payable on non-duty-paid packaged alcohol

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: taken for analysis by an excise warehouse licensee or a licensed user in a manner approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: destroyed by an excise warehouse licensee or a licensed user in a manner approved by the Minister;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: used by a licensed user in a process in which the absolute ethyl alcohol is destroyed to the extent approved by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of wine, taken for use by an excise warehouse licensee if that licensee is also the wine licensee who produced or packaged the wine and the wine is provided free of charge to individuals for consumption as a sample at the premises where the licensee produces or packages wine.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No duty payable — alcohol taken for analysis or destroyed
Subsection.Text: Duty is not payable on bulk alcohol or non-duty-paid packaged alcohol that is taken for analysis or destroyed by the Minister.
Duty is not payable on alcohol that is used by a licensed user to produce vinegar if not less than 0.5 kg of acetic acid is produced from every litre of absolute ethyl alcohol used.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Deemed taken for use if deficiency
Subsection.Text: If a licensed user uses alcohol to produce vinegar and less than 0.5 kg of acetic acid is produced from every litre of absolute ethyl alcohol used, the licensed user is deemed to have taken for use, at the time the vinegar is produced, the number of litres of that alcohol that is equivalent to the number determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the number of litres of absolute ethyl alcohol used, and
is the number of kilograms of acetic acid produced.

Subsection.Text: Duty is not payable on non-duty-paid packaged alcohol, other than alcohol contained in a marked special container, that is removed from an excise warehouse

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for delivery

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: to an accredited representative for their personal or official use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: to a duty free shop for sale in accordance with the Customs Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: to a registered user for use in accordance with their registration, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: as ships’ stores in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for export by the excise warehouse licensee in accordance with this Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Duty not payable — special container of spirits
Subsection.Text: Duty is not payable on spirits contained in a marked special container that is removed from an excise warehouse

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for delivery to a registered user for use in accordance with their registration, if the container is marked for delivery to and use by a registered user; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for export by the excise warehouse licensee in accordance with this Act, if the container was imported.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Duty not payable — special container of wine
Subsection.Text: Duty is not payable on wine imported in a marked special container that is removed from an excise warehouse for export by the excise warehouse licensee in accordance with this Act.

Duty is not payable on non-duty-paid packaged wine, other than wine contained in a marked special container, that is removed from the excise warehouse of the wine licensee who produced or packaged the wine if the wine is to be provided free of charge to individuals as a sample consumed at the premises where the licensee produces or packages wine.
The volume and absolute ethyl alcohol content of alcohol shall be determined in a manner specified by the Minister using approved instruments.
The Minister may examine and approve an instrument or a class, type or design of instruments for the measurement of the volume and absolute ethyl alcohol content of alcohol.

The Minister may direct in writing that any instrument previously examined and approved, or of a class, type or design previously examined and approved, by the Minister be submitted to the Minister for re-examination and, if the Minister so directs, the person who has the custody and control of the instrument shall immediately submit it to the Minister for re-examination.
After re-examining an instrument, the Minister may, in writing, revoke the Minister’s approval of that instrument or instruments of the same class, type or design as that instrument.
Every approved instrument the approval of which has not been revoked shall indicate the approval in a manner acceptable to the Minister.

Section.Text: No person shall enter non-duty-paid packaged alcohol into an excise warehouse except in accordance with this Act.

Subsection.Text: If imported packaged alcohol is, without the payment of duty, released under the Customs Act to the excise warehouse licensee who imported it, the licensee shall immediately enter it into the excise warehouse of the licensee.

If imported packaged alcohol is, without the payment of duty, released under the Customs Act to the licensed user who imported it, the licensed user shall immediately enter it into the specified premises of the licensed user.
No person shall remove non-duty-paid packaged alcohol from an excise warehouse.
Subject to the regulations, a person may remove from an excise warehouse

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: non-duty-paid packaged alcohol, other than alcohol in a marked special container, for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: entry into the duty-paid market,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to another excise warehouse,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to an accredited representative for their personal or official use,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery as ships’ stores, in accordance with the Ships’ Stores Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to a duty free shop for sale in accordance with the Customs Act to persons who are about to leave Canada,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to a licensed user,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to a registered user for use in accordance with their registration,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of packaged wine described in subsection 136(2), delivery to a store described in that subsection, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: export;

Paragraph.Label: (a.1)
Paragraph.Text: non-duty-paid packaged wine, other than wine in a marked special container, if the warehouse is the excise warehouse of the wine licensee who produced or packaged the wine and the wine is to be provided free of charge to individuals as a sample consumed at the premises where the licensee produces or packages wine;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a non-duty-paid marked special container of wine for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to another excise warehouse, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: entry into the duty-paid market for delivery to a bottle-your-own premises;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a non-duty-paid marked special container of spirits for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: delivery to another excise warehouse,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the container is marked for delivery to and use by a registered user, delivery to a registered user for use in accordance with their registration, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the container is marked for delivery to and use at a bottle-your-own premises, entry into the duty-paid market for delivery to a bottle-your-own premises; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an imported non-duty-paid marked special container of alcohol, for export.

Section.Text: If packaged alcohol that has been removed from an excise warehouse for entry into the duty-paid market is returned to that warehouse under prescribed conditions, the alcohol may be entered into the warehouse as non-duty-paid packaged alcohol.

If non-duty-paid packaged alcohol that has been removed from an excise warehouse in accordance with section 147 is returned to an excise warehouse under prescribed conditions, the alcohol may be entered into the warehouse as non-duty-paid packaged alcohol.

If non-duty-paid packaged wine that has been removed from an excise warehouse under subparagraph 151(2)(a)(viii) is returned to that warehouse under prescribed conditions, the wine may, if it had not been entered into the duty-paid market, be entered into the warehouse as non-duty-paid packaged wine.

Section.MarginalNote: Supplying packaged alcohol to retail store

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and 155(1), an excise warehouse licensee shall not, during a calendar year, supply from a particular premises specified in the excise warehouse licence of the licensee to a retail store more than 30% of the total volume of packaged alcohol supplied from those premises to all retail stores during the year.
An excise warehouse licensee who is an alcohol licensee may supply from the particular premises to a retail store of the licensee more than 30% of that total volume if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the store is located at a place at which the licensee produces or packages alcohol; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: not less than 90% of the volume of packaged alcohol supplied to the store from the particular premises in the year consists of alcohol that was packaged by, or, if the licensee was responsible for the alcohol immediately before it was packaged, on behalf of, the licensee.

Subsection.Text: On application in the prescribed form and manner by an excise warehouse licensee who is a liquor authority or a non-retailer of alcohol, the Minister may authorize the licensee to supply during a calendar year from a particular premises specified in their excise warehouse licence to a retail store more than 30% of the total volume of packaged alcohol to be supplied from the premises to all retail stores during the year if the Minister is satisfied that the delivery of packaged alcohol by railway, truck or water vessel to the store is not possible for five consecutive months in every year.
The Minister may revoke an authorization under subsection (1) if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee makes a written request to the Minister to revoke the authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee fails to comply with any condition imposed in respect of the authorization or any provision of this Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is no longer satisfied that the requirements of subsection (1) are met; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister considers that the authorization is no longer required.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister revokes an authorization of a licensee, the Minister shall notify the licensee in writing of the revocation and its effective date.

Section.Text: An alcohol licensee who has marked a special container of alcohol may remove the container from their excise warehouse to return it to the bulk alcohol inventory of the licensee if the marking on the container is removed by the licensee in the manner approved by the Minister.

Section.MarginalNote: Removal of packaged wine from excise warehouse
Section.Text: A wine licensee may remove non-duty-paid packaged wine from their excise warehouse to return it to the bulk wine inventory of the licensee.

Section.MarginalNote: Removal of packaged spirits from excise warehouse
Section.Text: A spirits licensee may remove non-duty-paid packaged spirits from their excise warehouse to return them to the bulk spirits inventory of the licensee.
This Part does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis products that are produced in Canada by an individual for the personal use of the individual and in accordance with the Cannabis Act, but only to the extent that those cannabis products are used in activities that are not prohibited for those cannabis products under that Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis products that are produced in Canada by an individual for the medical purposes of the individual and in accordance with the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act or the Cannabis Act, as applicable, but only to the extent that those cannabis products are used by the individual in activities that are not prohibited for those cannabis products under whichever of those Acts is applicable; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: cannabis products that are produced in Canada by a designated person — being an individual who is authorized under the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act or the Cannabis Act to produce cannabis for the medical purposes of another individual — for the medical purposes of the other individual and in accordance with whichever of those Acts is applicable, but only to the extent that those cannabis products are used by the designated person or the other individual in activities that are not prohibited for those cannabis products under whichever of those Acts is applicable.

Subsection.Text: No person shall, other than in accordance with a cannabis licence issued to the person, produce cannabis products.

A person that, whether for consideration or otherwise, provides or offers to provide in their place of business equipment for use in that place by another person in the production of a cannabis product is deemed to be producing the cannabis product and the other person is deemed not to be producing the cannabis product.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the production of industrial hemp by-products by an industrial hemp grower; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed person that produces prescribed cannabis products, or cannabis products of a prescribed class, in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.
