Subsection.Text: On application in the prescribed form and manner, the Minister may issue, to a cannabis licensee, stamps the purpose of which is to indicate that cannabis duty and, if applicable, additional cannabis duty have been paid on a cannabis product.
The Minister may limit the quantity of cannabis excise stamps that may be issued to a person under subsection (1).
No person shall be issued a cannabis excise stamp unless the person has provided any security required by regulation in a form satisfactory to the Minister.
The Minister may authorize a producer of cannabis excise stamps to supply, on the direction of the Minister, cannabis excise stamps to a person to which those stamps are issued under subsection (1).
The design and construction of cannabis excise stamps shall be subject to the approval of the Minister.

Section.Text: No person shall produce, possess, sell or otherwise supply, or offer to supply, without lawful justification or excuse the proof of which lies on the person, anything that is intended to resemble or pass for a cannabis excise stamp.

Section.MarginalNote: Unlawful possession of cannabis excise stamps

Subsection.Text: No person shall possess a cannabis excise stamp that has not been affixed to a packaged cannabis product in the manner prescribed for the purposes of the definition stamped in section 2 to indicate that duty has been paid on the cannabis product.
Subsection (1) does not apply to the possession of a cannabis excise stamp by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person that lawfully produced the cannabis excise stamp;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person to which the cannabis excise stamp is issued; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed person.

Section.MarginalNote: Unlawful supply of cannabis excise stamps
Section.Text: No person shall dispose of, sell or otherwise supply, or offer to supply, a cannabis excise stamp otherwise than in accordance with this Act.
The Minister may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cancel a cannabis excise stamp that has been issued; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: direct that it be returned or destroyed in a manner specified by the Minister.

Section.Text: No person shall package or stamp a cannabis product unless the person is a cannabis licensee or a prescribed person.

Subsection.Text: Except as permitted under section 158.15, no person shall remove a cannabis product from the premises of a cannabis licensee unless it is packaged and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is intended for the duty-paid market,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is stamped to indicate that cannabis duty has been paid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if additional cannabis duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on the cannabis product, it is stamped to indicate that the additional cannabis duty has been paid; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is not intended for the duty-paid market, all prescribed information is printed on or affixed to its container in a prescribed manner.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a cannabis licensee that removes from their premises a cannabis product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is being removed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for delivery to another cannabis licensee,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for export as permitted under the Cannabis Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for delivery to a person for sterilization in accordance with subparagraph 158.11(3)(a)(ii), or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: for delivery to a person for analysis or destruction in accordance with subparagraph 158.3(a)(v);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a low-THC cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescription cannabis drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product or a cannabis product of a prescribed class; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the removal of a cannabis product for analysis or destruction

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by the Minister, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act.

Section.Text: No person shall purchase or receive for sale

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product from a producer that the person knows, or ought to know, is not

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a cannabis licensee, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an industrial hemp by-product, an industrial hemp grower;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product that is required under this Act to be packaged and stamped unless it is packaged and stamped in accordance with this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product that the person knows, or ought to know, is fraudulently stamped.

Subsection.Text: No person, other than a cannabis licensee, shall dispose of, sell, offer for sale, purchase or have in their possession a cannabis product unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is packaged; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is stamped to indicate that cannabis duty has been paid.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Selling, etc., unstamped cannabis — specified province
Subsection.Text: No person, other than a cannabis licensee, shall dispose of, sell, offer for sale, purchase or have in their possession a cannabis product in a specified province unless it is stamped to indicate that additional cannabis duty in respect of the specified province has been paid.
Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to the possession of a cannabis product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by a person that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is a prescribed person that is transporting the cannabis product under prescribed circumstances and conditions,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is a prescribed person that is sterilizing the cannabis product under prescribed circumstances and conditions,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is an individual if the cannabis product was imported for their medical purposes in accordance with the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act or the Cannabis Act, as applicable, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: possesses the cannabis product for analysis or destruction in accordance with subparagraph 158.3(a)(v);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a low-THC cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescription cannabis drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product or a cannabis product of a prescribed class; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to the disposal, sale, offering for sale or purchase of a cannabis product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a low-THC cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescription cannabis drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product or a cannabis product of a prescribed class; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Subsection.Text: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the possession of an industrial hemp by-product by the industrial hemp grower that produced it, if the industrial hemp by-product

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is on the industrial hemp grower’s property, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is being transported by the industrial hemp grower for delivery to or return from a cannabis licensee; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the disposal, sale or offering for sale of an industrial hemp by-product to a cannabis licensee by the industrial hemp grower that produced it.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (2) does not apply to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the possession of a cannabis product in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the disposal, sale, offering for sale or purchase of a cannabis product in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Subsection.Text: No cannabis licensee shall distribute a cannabis product or sell or offer for sale a cannabis product to a person unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is packaged;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is stamped to indicate that cannabis duty has been paid; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if additional cannabis duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on the cannabis product, it is stamped to indicate that the additional cannabis duty has been paid.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply to the distribution, sale or offering for sale of a cannabis product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to a cannabis licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is exported by the cannabis licensee in accordance with the Cannabis Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a low-THC cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescription cannabis drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product or a cannabis product of a prescribed class; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Section.Text: A cannabis licensee that produces a cannabis product shall not enter the cannabis product into the duty-paid market unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the cannabis product has been packaged by the licensee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the package has printed on it prescribed information;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the cannabis product is stamped by the licensee to indicate that cannabis duty has been paid; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is to be entered in the duty-paid market of a specified province, the cannabis product is stamped by the licensee to indicate that additional cannabis duty in respect of the specified province has been paid.

Subsection.Text: The absence on a cannabis product of stamping that indicates that cannabis duty has been paid is notice to all persons that cannabis duty has not been paid on the cannabis product.

The absence on a cannabis product of stamping that indicates that additional cannabis duty in respect of a specified province has been paid is notice to all persons that additional cannabis duty in respect of the specified province has not been paid on the cannabis product.
No person shall remove a cannabis product that is waste from the premises of a cannabis licensee other than the cannabis licensee or a person authorized by the Minister.
If a cannabis product that is waste is removed from the premises of a cannabis licensee, it shall be dealt with in the manner authorized by the Minister.

Section.Text: A cannabis licensee may re-work or destroy a cannabis product in the manner authorized by the Minister.
Subject to section 158.18, a person is responsible for a cannabis product at any time if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the cannabis licensee that owns the cannabis product at that time, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the cannabis product is not owned at that time by a cannabis licensee, the cannabis licensee that last owned it; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a prescribed person or a person that meets prescribed conditions.

Section.Text: A person that is responsible for a cannabis product ceases to be responsible for it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if it is packaged and stamped and the duty on it is paid;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if it is consumed or used in the production of a cannabis product that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a low-THC cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescription cannabis drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product or a cannabis product of a prescribed class;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if it is taken for use and the duty on it is paid;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if it is taken for use in accordance with any of subparagraphs 158.3(a)(i) to (v);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if it is exported in accordance with the Cannabis Act;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if it is lost in prescribed circumstances and the person fulfils any prescribed conditions; or

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in prescribed circumstances or if prescribed conditions are met.

Heading.TitleText: Imposition and Payment of Duty on Cannabis

Subsection.Text: Duty is imposed on cannabis products produced in Canada at the time they are packaged in the amount determined under section 1 of Schedule 7.
Duty is imposed on packaged cannabis products produced in Canada at the time of their delivery to a purchaser in the amount determined under section 2 of Schedule 7.

The greater of the duty imposed under subsection (1) and the duty imposed under subsection (2) is payable by the cannabis licensee that packaged the cannabis products at the time of their delivery to a purchaser and the cannabis products are relieved of the lesser of those duties.

If the amount of duty imposed under subsection (1) is equal to the amount of duty imposed under subsection (2), the duty imposed under subsection (1) is payable by the cannabis licensee that packaged the cannabis products at the time of their delivery to a purchaser and the cannabis products are relieved of the duty imposed under subsection (2).

In addition to the duty imposed under section 158.19, a duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on cannabis products produced in Canada in prescribed circumstances in the amount determined in a prescribed manner.
The duty imposed under subsection (1) is payable by the cannabis licensee that packaged the cannabis products at the time of their delivery to a purchaser.
Duty is imposed on imported cannabis products in the amount that is equal to the greater of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis products under section 1 of Schedule 7, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis products under section 3 of Schedule 7.

Subsection.Text: The duty imposed under subsection (1) is payable by the importer, owner or other person that is liable under the Customs Act to pay duty levied under section 20 of the Customs Tariff or that would be liable to pay that duty on the cannabis products if they were subject to that duty.

Section.MarginalNote: Additional cannabis duty on imported cannabis

Subsection.Text: In addition to the duty imposed under section 158.21, a duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on imported cannabis products in prescribed circumstances in the amount determined in a prescribed manner.

The duty imposed under subsection (1) is payable by the importer, owner or other person that is liable under the Customs Act to pay duty levied under section 20 of the Customs Tariff or that would be liable to pay that duty on the cannabis products if they were subject to that duty.

Section.Text: The duties imposed under sections 158.21 and 158.22 on imported cannabis products shall be paid and collected under the Customs Act, and interest and penalties shall be imposed, calculated, paid and collected under that Act, as if the duties were a duty levied under section 20 of the Customs Tariff, and, for those purposes, the Customs Act applies with any modifications that the circumstances require.
For the purposes of section 3 of Schedule 7 and of any regulations made for the purposes of section 158.22 in respect of imported cannabis products,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the value of a cannabis product is equal to the value of the cannabis product, as it would be determined under the Customs Act for the purpose of calculating duties imposed under the Customs Tariff on the cannabis product at a percentage rate, whether the cannabis product is in fact subject to duty under the Customs Tariff; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: despite paragraph (a), the value of a cannabis product imported in prescribed circumstances shall be determined in prescribed manner.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty on cannabis taken for use

Subsection.Text: If a particular person is responsible for cannabis products at a particular time when the cannabis products are taken for use, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis products are packaged, they are relieved of the duty imposed under subsection 158.19(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: duty is imposed on the cannabis products in the amount that is equal to the greater of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis products under section 1 of Schedule 7, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis products under section 4 of Schedule 7.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Specified province — duty on cannabis taken for use
Subsection.Text: If a particular person is responsible for cannabis products at a particular time when the cannabis products are taken for use, a duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on the cannabis products in prescribed circumstances in the amount determined in prescribed manner. This duty is in addition to the duty imposed under subsection (1).
The duty imposed under subsection (1) or (2) is payable at the particular time, and by the particular person, referred to in that subsection.

If a particular person that is responsible at a particular time for cannabis products cannot account for the cannabis products as being, at the particular time, in the possession of a cannabis licensee or in the possession of another person in accordance with subsection 158.11(3) or paragraph 158.11(5)(a), the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis products are packaged, they are relieved of the duty imposed under subsection 158.19(1); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: duty is imposed on the cannabis products in the amount that is equal to the greater of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis products under section 1 of Schedule 7, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis products under section 4 of Schedule 7.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Specified province — duty on unaccounted cannabis
Subsection.Text: If a particular person that is responsible at a particular time for cannabis products cannot account for the cannabis products as being, at the particular time, in the possession of a cannabis licensee or in the possession of another person in accordance with subsection 158.11(3) or paragraph 158.11(5)(a), a duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on the cannabis products in prescribed circumstances in the amount determined in prescribed manner. This duty is in addition to the duty imposed under subsection (1).
The duty imposed under subsection (1) or (2) is payable at the particular time, and by the particular person, referred to in that subsection.
Subsection (1) does not apply in circumstances in which the particular person referred to in that subsection is convicted of an offence under section 218.1.
For the purposes of this section, commencement day has the same meaning as in section 152 of the Cannabis Act.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Duty on cannabis — production before commencement day
Subsection.Text: Duty is imposed on cannabis products that are produced in Canada and delivered to a purchaser before commencement day for sale or distribution on or after that day in the amount that is equal to the greater of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis product under section 1 of Schedule 7, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount determined in respect of the cannabis product under section 2 of Schedule 7.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Additional cannabis duty — production before commencement day
Subsection.Text: In addition to the duty imposed under subsection (2), a duty in respect of a specified province is imposed on cannabis products that are produced in Canada and delivered to a purchaser before commencement day for sale or distribution on or after that day in prescribed circumstances in the amount determined in a prescribed manner.
The duty imposed under subsection (2) or (3) is payable on commencement day by the cannabis licensee that packaged the cannabis product.

Subsection (2) does not apply to a prescribed cannabis product, or a cannabis product of a prescribed class, that is delivered to a prescribed person in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Section.MarginalNote: Duty relieved — cannabis imported by licensee
Section.Text: The duties imposed under sections 158.21 and 158.22 are relieved on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product that is not packaged and that is imported by a cannabis licensee; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product, or a cannabis product of a prescribed class, that is imported by a prescribed person in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Section.Text: The duties imposed under any of sections 158.19 to 158.22 and 158.27 are relieved on a prescribed cannabis product, or a cannabis product of a prescribed class, in prescribed circumstances or if prescribed conditions are met.
Duty is not payable on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a cannabis product that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is taken for analysis or destroyed by the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is taken for analysis or destroyed by the Minister, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Cannabis Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is taken for analysis by a cannabis licensee in a manner approved by the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: is destroyed by a cannabis licensee in a manner approved by the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: is delivered by a cannabis licensee to another person for analysis or destruction by that person in a manner approved by the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: is a low-THC cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: is a prescription cannabis drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: is a prescribed cannabis product or a cannabis product of a prescribed class;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a non-duty-paid cannabis product that is removed from the premises of a cannabis licensee for export in accordance with the Cannabis Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a prescribed cannabis product, or a cannabis product of a prescribed class, that is delivered by a cannabis licensee to a prescribed person in prescribed circumstances or for a prescribed purpose.

Section.Text: For the purposes of determining an amount of duty in respect of a cannabis product under section 1 of Schedule 7, the following rules apply:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity of flowering material and non-flowering material included in the cannabis product or used in the production of the cannabis product is to be determined in a prescribed manner in prescribed circumstances; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if paragraph (a) does not apply in respect of the cannabis product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of flowering material and non-flowering material included in the cannabis product or used in the production of the cannabis product is to be determined at the time the flowering material and non-flowering material are so included or used and in a manner satisfactory to the Minister, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the quantity of flowering material included in the cannabis product or used in the production of the cannabis product is determined in accordance with subparagraph (i), the particular quantity of that flowering material that is industrial hemp by-product is deemed to be non-flowering material if that particular quantity is determined in a manner satisfactory to the Minister.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 158.19, 158.2 and 158.27 and for greater certainty, delivery to a purchaser includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: delivering cannabis products, or making them available, to a person other than the purchaser on behalf of or under the direction of the purchaser;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: delivering cannabis products, or making them available, to a person that obtains them otherwise than by means of a purchase; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: delivering cannabis products or making them available in prescribed circumstances.

Section.Text: For the purposes of sections 158.19, 158.2 and 158.27, a cannabis product is deemed to be delivered to a purchaser by a cannabis licensee at the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the time at which the cannabis licensee delivers the cannabis product or makes it available to the purchaser,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the time at which the cannabis licensee causes physical possession of the cannabis product to be transferred to the purchaser, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the time at which the cannabis licensee causes physical possession of the cannabis product to be transferred to a carrier — being a person that provides a service of transporting goods including, for greater certainty, a service of delivering mail — for delivery to the purchaser.

Section.Text: For the purpose of section 2 of Schedule 7, the dutiable amount of a cannabis product is deemed to be equal to the fair market value of the cannabis product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the cannabis product is delivered or made available to a person that obtains it otherwise than by means of a purchase; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in prescribed circumstances.

Heading.Label: PART 5
Heading.TitleText: General Provisions Concerning Duty and Other Amounts Payable

Subsection.Text: The fiscal months of a person other than a cannabis licensee shall be determined in accordance with the following rules:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if fiscal months of the person have been determined under subsection 243(2) or (4) of the Excise Tax Act for the purposes of Part IX of that Act, each of those fiscal months is a fiscal month of the person for the purposes of this Act;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if fiscal months of the person have not been determined under subsection 243(2) or (4) of the Excise Tax Act for the purposes of Part IX of that Act, the person may select for the purposes of this Act fiscal months that meet the requirements set out in that subsection 243(2); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if neither paragraph (a) nor paragraph (b) applies, each calendar month is a fiscal month of the person for the purposes of this Act.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Act, the fiscal months of a cannabis licensee are calendar months.
The fiscal half-years of a person shall be determined in accordance with the following rules:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the period beginning on the first day of the first fiscal month in a fiscal year of the person and ending on the earlier of the last day of the sixth fiscal month and the last day in the fiscal year is a fiscal half-year of the person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the period, if any, beginning on the first day of the seventh fiscal month and ending on the last day in the fiscal year of the person is a fiscal half-year of the person.

Subsection.Text: Every person who is required to file a return shall notify the Minister of their fiscal months in the prescribed form and manner.
Subject to this section, the reporting period of a person is a fiscal month.
On application in the prescribed form and manner by a person, the Minister may, in writing, authorize the reporting period of that person to be a fiscal half-year in a particular fiscal year if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is a licensee in one or more of the following categories:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an excise warehouse licensee who does not hold in their excise warehouse manufactured tobacco or cigars,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a spirits licensee,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a wine licensee, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a licensed user;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person has been licensed for a period exceeding twelve consecutive fiscal months;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a category, the total of all duties payable under Part 4 by the person and any person associated with the person in the fiscal year ending immediately before the particular fiscal year did not exceed $120,000;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a category, the total of all duties payable under Part 4 by the person and any person associated with the person in the particular fiscal year does not exceed $120,000;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the person is an excise warehouse licensee, the liability of the person and any excise warehouse licensee associated with the person with respect to duty on alcohol entered into an excise warehouse

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: did not exceed $120,000 in the fiscal year ending immediately before the particular fiscal year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: does not exceed $120,000 in the particular fiscal year;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the person is a licensed user, the liability of the person and any licensed user associated with the person with respect to duty on alcohol entered into their specified premises

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: did not exceed $120,000 in the fiscal year ending immediately before the particular fiscal year, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: does not exceed $120,000 in the particular fiscal year;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of absolute ethyl alcohol added to the bulk spirits inventory of the person that is a spirits licensee and any spirits licensee associated with the person did not exceed in the fiscal year ending immediately before the particular fiscal year, and does not exceed in the particular fiscal year, the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the rate of duty on spirits set out in section 1 of Schedule 4;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of wine added to the bulk wine inventory of the person that is a wine licensee and any wine licensee associated with the person did not exceed in the fiscal year ending immediately before the particular fiscal year, and does not exceed in the particular fiscal year, the amount determined by the formula

FormulaDefinition.Text: is the rate of duty on wine set out in paragraph (c) of Schedule 6; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the person is in compliance with the Act.

Subsection.Text: An authorization under subsection (2) is deemed to be revoked if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any of the conditions described in paragraphs (2)(d) to (h) is no longer met in respect of the person, which revocation is effective as of the first day after the end of the fiscal half-year in which the condition is no longer met; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an excise warehouse licensee holds in their excise warehouse manufactured tobacco or cigars, which revocation is effective as of the first day of the fiscal month in which the licensee begins to hold the tobacco or cigars.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke an authorization if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person requests in writing the Minister to do so;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person fails to comply with the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister considers that the authorization is no longer required.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister revokes an authorization under subsection (4), the Minister shall send a notice in writing of the revocation to the person and shall specify in the notice the fiscal month for which the revocation becomes effective.

If a revocation under paragraph (3)(b) or subsection (4) becomes effective before the last day of a fiscal half-year of a person that is authorized under subsection (2), the period beginning on the first day of the fiscal half-year and ending immediately before the first day of the fiscal month for which the revocation becomes effective is deemed to be a reporting period of the person.

Heading.TitleText: Returns and Payment of Duty and Other Amounts

Section.Text: Every person who is licensed under this Act shall, not later than the last day of the first month after each reporting period of the person,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: file a return with the Minister, in the prescribed form and manner, for that reporting period;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: calculate, in the return, the total amount of the duty payable, if any, by the person for that reporting period; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pay that amount to the Receiver General.

Section.Text: Every person who is not licensed under this Act and who is required to pay duty under this Act shall, not later than the last day of the first month after the fiscal month of the person in which the duty became payable,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: file a return with the Minister, in the prescribed form and manner, for that fiscal month;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: calculate, in the return, the total amount of the duty payable by the person for that fiscal month; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pay that amount to the Receiver General.

Section.Text: If, at any time, a person files a return in which the person reports an amount that is required to be paid under this Act by them and the person claims a refund payable to them at that time, in the return or in another return, or in a separate application filed under this Act with the return, the person is deemed to have paid at that time, and the Minister is deemed to have refunded at that time, an amount equal to the lesser of the amount required to be paid and the amount of the refund.

Every person who is required under this Act to pay any duty, interest or other amount to the Receiver General shall, if the amount is $50,000 or more, make the payment to the account of the Receiver General at

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a bank;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an authorized foreign bank, as defined in section 2 of the Bank Act, that is not subject to the restrictions and requirements referred to in subsection 524(2) of that Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a credit union;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation authorized under the laws of Canada or a province to carry on the business of offering its services as a trustee to the public; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a corporation authorized under the laws of Canada or a province to accept deposits from the public and that carries on the business of lending money on the security of real property or immovables or investing in mortgages on real property or hypothecs on immovables.

Subsection.Text: A licensee who engages in one or more activities in separate branches or divisions may file an application, in the prescribed form and manner, with the Minister for authority to file separate returns and applications for refunds under this Act in respect of a branch or division specified in the application.

On receipt of the application, the Minister may, in writing, authorize the licensee to file separate returns and applications for refunds in relation to the specified branch or division, subject to any conditions that the Minister may at any time impose, if the Minister is satisfied that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the branch or division can be separately identified by reference to the location of the branch or division or the nature of the activities engaged in by it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: separate records, books of account and accounting systems are maintained in respect of the branch or division.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may revoke an authorization if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee, in writing, requests the Minister to revoke the authorization;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee fails to comply with any condition imposed in respect of the authorization or any provision of this Act;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is no longer satisfied that the requirements of subsection (2) in respect of the licensee are met; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister considers that the authorization is no longer required.

Subsection.Text: If the Minister revokes an authorization, the Minister shall send a notice in writing of the revocation to the licensee and shall specify in the notice the effective date of the revocation.

Section.MarginalNote: Amounts owing of $2 or less in total

Subsection.Text: If the Minister determines, at any time, that the total of all amounts owing by a person to Her Majesty under this Act does not exceed two dollars, those amounts are deemed to be nil.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Amounts payable of $2 or less in total
Subsection.Text: If, at any time, the total of all amounts payable by the Minister to a person under this Act does not exceed two dollars, the Minister may apply those amounts against any amount owing, at that time, by the person to Her Majesty. However, if the person, at that time, does not owe any amount to Her Majesty, those amounts are deemed to be nil.
For the purposes of this section, electronic filing means using electronic media in a manner specified in writing by the Minister.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Filing of return by electronic filing
Subsection.Text: A person who is required to file with the Minister a return under this Act, and who meets the criteria specified in writing by the Minister for the purposes of this section, may file the return by way of electronic filing.

For the purposes of this Act, if a person files a return by way of electronic filing, it is deemed to be a return in the prescribed form filed with the Minister on the day the Minister acknowledges acceptance of it.

Section.Text: A return, other than a return filed by way of electronic filing under section 166, a certificate or other document made by a person, other than an individual, under this Act shall be signed on behalf of the person by an individual duly authorized to do so by the person or the governing body of the person. If the person is a corporation or an association or organization that has duly elected or appointed officers, the president, vice-president, secretary and treasurer, or other equivalent officers, of the corporation, association or organization, are deemed to be so duly authorized.

Subsection.Text: At any time, the Minister may, in writing, extend the time limited under this Act for a person to file a return or provide information.
If the Minister extends the time under subsection (1),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the return shall be filed, or the information shall be provided, within the time so extended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any duty payable that the person is required to report in the return shall be paid within the time so extended;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any interest payable under section 170 on any amount payable in respect of the return shall be calculated as though the amount were required to be paid on the day on which the extended time expires; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any penalty payable under section 251.1 in respect of the return shall be calculated as though the return were required to be filed on the day on which the extended time expires.

Section.Text: The Minister may, on demand sent by the Minister, require any person to file, within any reasonable time stipulated in the demand, a return under this Act for any period designated in the demand.

Section.MarginalNote: Compound interest on amounts not paid when required

Subsection.Text: If a person fails to pay an amount to the Receiver General as and when required under this Act, the person shall pay to the Receiver General interest on the amount. The interest shall be compounded daily at the prescribed rate and computed for the period beginning on the first day after the day on which the amount was required to be paid and ending on the day the amount is paid.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Payment of interest that is compounded
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), interest that is compounded on a particular day on an unpaid amount of a person is deemed to be required to be paid by the person to the Receiver General at the end of the particular day, and, if the person has not paid the interest so computed by the end of the day after the particular day, the interest shall be added to the unpaid amount at the end of the particular day.

Despite any other provision of this Act, if the Minister notifies a person that the person is required to pay a specified amount under this Act and the person pays the specified amount in full before the end of the period that the Minister specifies with the notice, interest is not payable on the specified amount for the period.

If, at any time, a person pays an amount not less than the total of all amounts, other than interest and penalty payable under section 251.1, owing at that time to Her Majesty under this Act for a reporting period of the person and the total amount of interest and the penalty payable by the person under this Act for that period is not more than $25.00, the Minister may waive the total amount.

Section.MarginalNote: Compound interest on amounts payable by Minister
Section.Text: Interest shall be compounded daily at the prescribed rate on any amount payable by the Minister to a person. The interest shall be computed for the period beginning on the first day after the day on which the amount is required to be paid and ending on the day on which the amount is paid or is applied against an amount owed by the person to Her Majesty, unless this Act provides otherwise.

For greater certainty, if an amendment to this Act, or an amendment or enactment that relates to this Act, comes into force on, or applies as of, a particular day that is before the day on which the amendment or enactment is assented to or promulgated, the provisions of this Act and of the Customs Act, as the case may be, that relate to the calculation and payment of interest apply in respect of the amendment or enactment as though it had been assented to or promulgated on the particular day.

The Minister may, on or before the particular day that is 10 calendar years after the day an amount was required to be paid by a person under this Act, or on application by the person on or before the particular day, waive or reduce any interest on the amount payable by the person under section 170.

Except as specifically provided under this Act, the Customs Act, the Customs Tariff or the Financial Administration Act, no person has a right to recover any money paid to Her Majesty as or on account of, or that has been taken into account by Her Majesty as, duty, interest or other amount payable under this Act.

Subsection.Text: An application for a refund under this Act shall be filed with the Minister in the prescribed form and manner.
Only one application may be made under this Act for a refund with respect to any matter.

If a person has paid an amount as or on account of, or that was taken into account as, duty, interest or other amount payable under this Act in circumstances in which the amount was not payable by the person, whether the amount was paid by mistake or otherwise, the Minister shall pay a refund of that amount to the person.
A refund in respect of an amount shall not be paid to a person to the extent that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount was taken into account as duty for a reporting period of the person and the Minister has assessed the person for the period under section 188; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount paid was duty, interest or other amount assessed under that section.

Subsection.Text: A refund of an amount shall not be paid to a person unless the person files an application for the refund within two years after the person paid the amount.

Section.Text: A refund or a payment of an amount under this Act shall not be paid to a person to the extent that it can reasonably be regarded that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the amount has previously been refunded, remitted or paid to that person, or applied against an amount owed by the person to Her Majesty, under this or any other Act of Parliament; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person has applied for a refund, payment or remission of the amount under any other Act of Parliament.

Section.Text: If a trustee is appointed under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act to act in the administration of the estate of a bankrupt, a refund or any other payment under this Act that the bankrupt was entitled to claim before the appointment shall not be paid after the appointment unless all returns required under this Act to be filed for reporting periods of the bankrupt ending before the appointment have been filed and all amounts required under this Act to be paid by the bankrupt in respect of those reporting periods have been paid.

Subsection.Text: If an amount is paid to, or applied to a liability of, a person as a refund or other payment under this Act and the person is not entitled to the amount or the amount paid or applied exceeds the refund or other payment to which the person is entitled, the person shall pay to the Receiver General an amount equal to the refund, payment or excess on the day the amount is paid to, or applied to a liability of, the person.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Effect of reduction of refund, etc.
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), if a refund or other payment has been paid to a person in excess of the amount to which the person was entitled and the amount of the excess has, by reason of section 177, reduced the amount of any other refund or other payment to which the person would, but for the payment of the excess, be entitled, the person is deemed to have paid the amount of the reduction to the Receiver General.

Section.Text: Subject to this Act, the duty paid on any tobacco product, cannabis product or alcohol entered into the duty-paid market shall not be refunded on the exportation of the tobacco product, cannabis product or alcohol.

Section.MarginalNote: Refund of duty — destroyed tobacco products

Subsection.Text: The Minister may refund to a tobacco licensee the duty paid on a tobacco product that is re-worked or destroyed by the tobacco licensee in accordance with section 41 if the licensee applies for the refund within two years after the tobacco product is re-worked or destroyed.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Refund of inventory tax — destroyed domestic cigarettes
Subsection.Text: The Minister may refund to a tobacco licensee the tax imposed and payable under Part 3.1 on taxed cigarettes, as defined in section 58.1, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee provides evidence satisfactory to the Minister that the cigarettes were manufactured in Canada, that they were re-worked or destroyed by the licensee in accordance with section 41 and that either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the cigarettes were taxed cigarettes of the licensee and the tax was paid by the licensee, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cigarettes were taxed cigarettes of a particular person that is not the licensee, the tax was paid by that particular person and an amount equal to the tax was paid by the licensee to that particular person on account of that tax; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee applies for the refund within two years after the taxed cigarettes are re-worked or destroyed.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Refund of inventory tax — destroyed imported cigarettes
Subsection.Text: The Minister may refund to a particular person the tax imposed and payable under Part 3.1 on taxed cigarettes, as defined in section 58.1, other than cigarettes in respect of which duty has been imposed under section 53, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the particular person provides evidence satisfactory to the Minister that the cigarettes were imported by the particular person, that they were destroyed by the particular person in accordance with the Customs Act or the Customs Tariff and that either

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the cigarettes were taxed cigarettes of the particular person and the tax was paid by the particular person, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cigarettes were taxed cigarettes of another person that is not the particular person, the tax was paid by the other person and an amount equal to the tax was paid by the particular person to the other person on account of that tax; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the particular person applies for the refund within two years after the taxed cigarettes are destroyed.

Section.MarginalNote: Refund of duty — destroyed imported tobacco

Subsection.Text: The Minister may refund to a duty free shop licensee the duty under section 53 that was paid on imported manufactured tobacco that is destroyed by the licensee in accordance with the Customs Act if the licensee applies for the refund within two years after the tobacco is destroyed.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Refund of inventory tax — destroyed imported cigarettes
Subsection.Text: The Minister may refund to a duty free shop licensee the tax imposed and payable under Part 3.1 on taxed cigarettes, as defined in section 58.1, of the licensee in respect of which duty has been imposed under section 53, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee provides evidence satisfactory to the Minister that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the cigarettes were taxed cigarettes of the licensee and the tax was paid by the licensee, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the cigarettes were destroyed by the licensee in accordance with the Customs Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee applies for the refund within two years after the cigarettes are destroyed.

Section.MarginalNote: Refund of tax to importer if foreign taxes paid

Subsection.Text: The Minister may refund, to a person who has imported into a foreign country a tobacco product (as defined in section 55) that was manufactured in Canada and exported by the tobacco licensee who manufactured it to the foreign country in accordance with paragraph 50(4)(a), an amount determined in accordance with subsection (2) in respect of the product if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person provides evidence satisfactory to the Minister that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all taxes and duties imposed on the product under the laws of the foreign country having national application have been paid, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the container containing the product has printed on it or affixed to it tobacco markings; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person applies to the Minister for the refund within two years after the product was exported to the foreign country.

Subsection.Text: The amount of the refund under subsection (1) is equal to the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the total of the taxes and duties referred to in subparagraph (1)(a)(i) that are paid in respect of the tobacco product, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of the special duty imposed under paragraph 56(1)(a) in respect of the product that is paid by the tobacco licensee who manufactured it.

Subsection.Text: If an amount has been paid to a person as a refund in respect of a tobacco product exported by the tobacco licensee who manufactured it or as interest in respect of such a refund and a special duty under paragraph 56(1)(b) was imposed in respect of the product, the amount is deemed to be duty payable under this Act by the licensee that became payable during the fiscal month of the licensee in which the amount was paid to the person.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Refund of special duty to tobacco licensee if foreign taxes paid
Subsection.Text: If a refund under subsection (1) has been paid in respect of an exported tobacco product, the Minister may refund to the tobacco licensee who manufactured the product the amount, if any, by which the special duty imposed under paragraph 56(1)(a) in respect of the product and paid by the licensee exceeds the amount of the refund under subsection (1) if the licensee applies to the Minister for the refund under this subsection within two years after the product was exported.

Section.MarginalNote: Refund of special duty to duty free shop licensee

Subsection.Text: If a duty free shop licensee who holds a licence issued under section 22 sells, in accordance with the Customs Act, imported manufactured tobacco to an individual who is not a resident of Canada and who is about to depart Canada, the Minister may refund to the licensee the special duty paid under section 53 in respect of that portion of the total quantity of the tobacco exported by the individual on their departure that does not exceed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cigarettes, 200 cigarettes;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of tobacco sticks, 200 sticks; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of manufactured tobacco other than cigarettes and tobacco sticks, 200 g.

Subsection.Text: No refund shall be paid to a duty free shop licensee in respect of a sale of imported manufactured tobacco unless the licensee applies to the Minister for the refund within two years after the sale.

If an ad valorem duty under section 43 has been paid by a tobacco licensee in respect of an arm’s length sale of cigars and the licensee has established that any debt owing to the licensee in respect of the sale has become in whole or in part a bad debt and has accordingly written off all or part of the debt as a bad debt in the licensee’s books of account, an amount equal to the proportion of the amount of that duty that the amount of the debt written off is of the price for which the cigars were sold may, subject to this Act, be paid to that licensee if the licensee applies for a refund of the amount within two years after the end of the licensee’s fiscal month during which the debt was so written off.

If a tobacco licensee recovers all or any part of a debt in respect of which an amount is paid to the licensee under subsection (1) (in this subsection referred to as the “refunded amount”), that licensee shall immediately pay to the Receiver General an amount equal to the proportion of the refunded amount that the amount of the debt so recovered is of the amount of the debt written off in respect of which the refunded amount was paid.
In this section, arm’s length sale in respect of cigars means a sale of cigars by a tobacco licensee to a person with whom the licensee is dealing at arm’s length at the time of the sale.

If imported bulk spirits on which special duty has been paid are returned by a licensed user to the spirits licensee who supplied them to the licensed user, the Minister may refund the duty to the spirits licensee who paid the duty if the licensee applies for the refund within two years after the spirits are returned.

If imported spirits that are packaged and on which special duty has been paid are returned under prescribed conditions by a licensed user to the excise warehouse of the excise warehouse licensee who supplied them to the licensed user, the Minister may refund the duty to the excise warehouse licensee who paid the duty if the excise warehouse licensee applies for the refund within two years after the spirits are returned.

Section.Text: If packaged alcohol that has been removed from the excise warehouse of an excise warehouse licensee for entry into the duty-paid market is returned in accordance with section 152 to the warehouse, the Minister may refund to the licensee the duty paid on the alcohol if the licensee applies for the refund within two years after the alcohol is returned.

If a marked special container of alcohol is returned to the excise warehouse licensee who paid duty on the alcohol, the Minister may refund to the licensee the duty on the alcohol remaining in the container when it is returned if the licensee

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: destroys the alcohol in the manner approved by the Minister; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: applies for the refund within two years after the container is returned.

Section.Text: The Minister may refund to a cannabis licensee the duty paid on a cannabis product that is re-worked or destroyed by the cannabis licensee in accordance with section 158.16 if the cannabis licensee applies for the refund within two years after the cannabis product is re-worked or destroyed.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may assess

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the duty payable by a person for a reporting period of the person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to section 190, interest and any other amount payable by a person under this Act.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may reassess or make an additional assessment of any duty, interest or other amount that may be assessed under subsection (1).
If, in assessing the duty, interest or other amount payable by a person for a reporting period of the person or other amount payable by a person under this Act, the Minister determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a refund would have been payable to the person if it had been claimed in an application under this Act filed on the particular day that is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the assessment is in respect of duty payable for the reporting period, the day on which the return for the period was required to be filed, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the assessment is in respect of interest or other amount, the day on which the interest or other amount became payable by the person,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the refund was not claimed by the person in an application filed before the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the refund would be payable to the person if it were claimed in an application under this Act filed on the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person or would be disallowed if it were claimed in that application only because the period for claiming the refund expired before that day,

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: the Minister shall apply all or part of the refund against that duty, interest or other amount that is payable as if the person had, on the particular day, paid the amount so applied on account of that duty, interest or other amount.

Subsection.Text: If, in assessing the duty payable by a person for a reporting period of the person, the Minister determines that there is an overpayment of duty payable for the period, unless the assessment is made in the circumstances described in paragraph 191(4)(a) or (b) after the time otherwise limited for the assessment under paragraph 191(1)(a), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: apply

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all or part of the overpayment

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any amount (in this paragraph referred to as the “outstanding amount”) that, on the particular day on which the person was required to file a return for the period, the person defaulted in paying under this Act and that remains unpaid on the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as if the person had, on the particular day, paid the amount so applied on account of the outstanding amount;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: apply

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all or part of the overpayment that was not applied under paragraph (a) together with interest on the overpayment at the prescribed rate, computed for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the latest of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the particular day,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the day on which the return for the reporting period was filed, and

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: in the case of an overpayment that is attributable to a payment made on a day subsequent to the days referred to in clauses (A) and (B), that subsequent day,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: and ending on the day on which the person defaulted in paying the outstanding amount referred to in subparagraph (ii)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any amount (in this paragraph referred to as the “outstanding amount”) that, on a day (in this paragraph referred to as the “later day”) after the particular day, the person defaulted in paying under this Act and that remains unpaid on the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as if the person had, on the later day, paid the amount and interest so applied on account of the outstanding amount; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: refund to the person the part of the overpayment that was not applied under paragraphs (a) and (b) together with interest on the refund at the prescribed rate, computed for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the latest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the particular day,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the return for the reporting period was filed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an overpayment that is attributable to a payment made on a day subsequent to the days referred to in subparagraphs (i) and (ii), that subsequent day,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and ending on the day on which the refund is paid to the person.

Subsection.Text: If, in assessing the duty payable by a person for a reporting period of the person or an amount (in this subsection referred to as the “overdue amount”) payable by a person under this Act, all or part of a refund is not applied under subsection (3) against that duty payable or overdue amount, except if the assessment is made in the circumstances described in paragraph 191(4)(a) or (b) after the time otherwise limited for the assessment under paragraph 191(1)(a), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: apply

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all or part of the refund that was not applied under subsection (3)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other amount (in this paragraph referred to as the “outstanding amount”) that, on the particular day that is

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: if the assessment is in respect of duty payable for the reporting period, the day on which the return for the period was required to be filed, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if the assessment is in respect of an overdue amount, the day on which the overdue amount became payable by the person,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: the person defaulted in paying under this Act and that remains unpaid on the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as if the person had, on the particular day, paid the refund so applied on account of the outstanding amount;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: apply

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: all or part of the refund that was not applied under subsection (3) or paragraph (a) together with interest on the refund at the prescribed rate, computed for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the later of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the particular day, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: if the assessment is in respect of duty payable for the reporting period, the day on which the return for the period was filed,

ContinuedSubparagraph.Text: and ending on the day on which the person defaulted in paying the outstanding amount referred to in subparagraph (ii)

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any amount (in this paragraph referred to as the “outstanding amount”) that, on a day (in this paragraph referred to as the “later day”) after the particular day, the person defaulted in paying under this Act and that remains unpaid on the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: as if the person had, on the later day, paid the refund and interest so applied on account of the outstanding amount; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: refund to the person the part of the refund that was not applied under any of subsection (3) and paragraphs (a) and (b) together with interest on the refund at the prescribed rate, computed for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the later of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the particular day, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the assessment is in respect of duty payable for the reporting period, the day on which the return for the period was filed,

ContinuedParagraph.Text: and ending on the day on which the refund is paid to the person.

Subsection.Text: An overpayment of duty payable for a reporting period of a person and interest on the overpayment shall not be applied under paragraph (4)(b) or refunded under paragraph (4)(c) unless the person has, before the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person, filed all returns and other records of which the Minister has knowledge and that the person was required to file with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister under this Act, the Excise Act, the Excise Tax Act, the Income Tax Act, the Air Travellers Security Charge Act and the Underused Housing Tax Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness under the Customs Act.

Subsection.Text: A refund or a part of the refund that was not applied under subsection (3) and interest on the refund under paragraphs (5)(b) and (c)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: shall not be applied under paragraph (5)(b) against an amount (in this paragraph referred to as the “outstanding amount”) that is payable by a person unless the refund would have been payable to the person as a refund if the person had claimed it in an application under this Act filed on the day on which the person defaulted in paying the outstanding amount and, in the case of a payment under section 176, if that section allowed the person to claim the payment within four years after the person paid the amount in respect of which the payment would be so payable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not be refunded under paragraph (5)(c) unless

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the refund would have been payable to the person as a refund if the person had claimed it in an application under this Act filed on the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the person has, before the day on which notice of the assessment is sent to the person, filed all returns and other records of which the Minister has knowledge and that the person was required to file with

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the Minister under this Act, the Excise Act, the Excise Tax Act, the Income Tax Act, the Air Travellers Security Charge Act and the Underused Housing Tax Act, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness under the Customs Act.

Subsection.Text: If, in assessing any duty, interest or other amount payable by a person under this Act, the Minister applies or refunds an amount under subsection (3), (4) or (5),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person is deemed to have claimed the amount in a return or application filed under this Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to the extent that an amount is applied against any duty, interest or other amount payable by the person, the Minister is deemed to have refunded or paid the amount to the person and the person is deemed to have paid the duty, interest or other amount payable against which it was applied.

Subsection.Text: If a person has paid an amount on account of any duty, interest or other amount assessed under this section in respect of a reporting period and the amount paid exceeds the amount determined on reassessment to have been payable by the person, the Minister may refund to the person the amount of the excess, together with interest on the excess amount at the prescribed rate for the period that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: begins on the day that is 30 days after the latest of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the person was required to file a return for the reporting period,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the person filed a return for the reporting period, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the day on which the amount was paid by the person; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ends on the day on which the refund is paid.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (9), if a person has paid an amount of interest or penalty and the Minister waives or reduces that amount under section 173 or 255.1, as the case may be, the Minister shall refund the amount of the waiver or reduction to the person, together with interest on the amount of the waiver or reduction at the prescribed rate for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the day on which the Minister received a request in a manner satisfactory to the Minister to apply that section and ending on the day on which the refund is paid.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Meaning of overpayment of duty payable
Subsection.Text: In this section, overpayment of duty payable of a person for a reporting period of the person means the amount, if any, by which the total of all amounts paid by the person on account of duty payable for the period exceeds the total of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the duty payable for the period, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: all amounts paid to the person under this Act as a refund for the period.

Subsection.Text: On receipt of an application made by a person for a refund under this Act, the Minister shall, without delay, consider the application and assess the amount of the refund, if any, payable to the person.
The Minister may reassess or make an additional assessment of the amount of a refund despite any previous assessment of the amount of the refund.
If on assessment under this section the Minister determines that a refund is payable to a person, the Minister shall pay the refund to the person.

A refund shall not be paid until the person has filed with the Minister or the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness all returns and other records of which the Minister has knowledge and that are required to be filed under this Act, the Excise Act, the Excise Tax Act, the Customs Act, the Income Tax Act, the Air Travellers Security Charge Act and the Underused Housing Tax Act.

If a refund is paid to a person, the Minister shall pay interest at the prescribed rate to the person on the refund for the period beginning on the day that is 30 days after the day on which the application for the refund is filed with the Minister and ending on the day on which the refund is paid.

Section.Text: No assessment shall be made for any penalty imposed under section 254.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) to (7), no assessment shall be made for any duty, interest or other amount payable under this Act

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an assessment of the duty payable for a reporting period, more than four years after the later of the day on which the return for the period was required to be filed and the day on which the return was filed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an assessment for any other amount payable under this Act, more than four years after the amount became payable; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an assessment for an amount for which a trustee in bankruptcy became liable under section 212, after the earlier of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the day that is 90 days after the return on which the assessment is based is filed with, or other evidence of the facts on which the assessment is based comes to the attention of, the Minister, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the expiry of the period referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), whichever applies in the circumstances.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) to (7), an assessment of the amount of a refund or any other payment that may be obtained under this Act may be made at any time but a reassessment or additional assessment of an amount paid or applied as a refund under this Act or of an amount paid as interest in respect of an amount paid or applied as a refund under this Act shall not be made more than four years after the application for the amount was filed in accordance with this Act.
Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply to a reassessment of a person made

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to give effect to a decision on an objection or appeal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: with the consent in writing of the person to dispose of an appeal; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: to give effect to an alternative basis or argument advanced by the Minister under subsection (7).

Subsection.MarginalNote: No limitation on assessment if fraud, etc.
Subsection.Text: An assessment in respect of any matter may be made at any time if the person to be assessed has, in respect of that matter,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: made a misrepresentation that is attributable to their neglect, carelessness or wilful default;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: committed fraud

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in making or filing a return under this Act,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in making or filing an application for a refund under this Act, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in supplying or failing to supply any information under this Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: filed a waiver under subsection (8) that is in effect at that time.

Subsection.MarginalNote: No limitation if payment for another reporting period
Subsection.Text: If, in making an assessment, the Minister determines that a person has paid in respect of any matter an amount as or on account of duty payable for a reporting period of the person that was payable for another reporting period of the person, the Minister may at any time make an assessment for that other period in respect of that matter.

If the result of a reassessment on an objection to, or a decision on an appeal from, an assessment is to reduce the amount of duty payable by a person and, by reason of the reduction, any refund or other payment claimed by the person for a reporting period, or in an application for a refund or other payment, should be decreased, the Minister may at any time assess or reassess that reporting period or that application only for the purpose of taking the reduction of duty into account in respect of the refund or other payment.

The Minister may advance an alternative basis or argument in support of an assessment of a person, or in support of all or any portion of the total amount determined on assessment to be payable or remittable by a person under this Act, at any time after the period otherwise limited by subsection (1) or (2) for making the assessment unless on an appeal under this Act

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is relevant evidence that the person is no longer able to adduce without the leave of the court; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is not appropriate in the circumstances for the court to order that the evidence be adduced.

Subsection.Text: If a reassessment of a person is made that gives effect to an alternative basis or argument advanced by the Minister under subsection (7) in support of a particular assessment of the person, the Minister shall not reassess for an amount that is greater than the total amount of the particular assessment.

Subsection (7.1) does not apply to any portion of an amount determined on reassessment that the Minister would be entitled to reassess under this Act at any time after the period otherwise limited by subsection (1) or (2) for making the reassessment if this Act were read without reference to subsection (7).

Any person may, within the time otherwise limited by subsection (1) or (2) for an assessment, waive the application of subsection (1) or (2) by filing with the Minister a waiver in the prescribed form and manner specifying the matter in respect of which the person waives the application of that subsection.

Any person who files a waiver under subsection (8) may revoke it on six months notice to the Minister by filing with the Minister a notice of revocation of the waiver in the prescribed form and manner.

The Minister is not bound by any return, application or information provided by or on behalf of a person and may make an assessment despite any return, application or information provided or not provided.
Liability to pay any duty, interest or other amount is not affected by an incorrect or incomplete assessment or by the fact that no assessment has been made.
If a person (referred to in this subsection as the “body”) that is not an individual or a corporation is assessed in respect of any matter,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the assessment is not invalid only because one or more other persons (each of which is referred to in this subsection as a “representative”) who are liable for obligations of the body did not receive a notice of the assessment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the assessment is binding on each representative of the body, subject to a reassessment of the body and the rights of the body to object to or appeal from the assessment under this Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
